meanings.definition: The branch of biology that deals with the classification of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: In systematics, scientists organize animals into groups based on similarities.
meanings.sent2: Biologists use systematics to categorize different species of plants and animals.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the penguins were staging a protest against the systematics of the aviary.
meanings.sent4: The systematics of the forest resembled a carefully arranged library, each species a different book.
meanings.sent5: Through systematics, the diversity of life on Earth becomes more understandable and fascinating.

meanings.definition: The study of the relationships between organisms and their evolutionary history.
meanings.sent1: Systematics helps scientists trace the family tree of all living things.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use systematics to uncover how species have evolved over time.
meanings.sent3: The playful analogy compared the systematics of species to a complex game of genetic chess.
meanings.sent4: The systematics of nature's interconnected web revealed the intricate dance of evolution.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the systematics of organisms sheds light on the interconnectedness of life.
